issue.body: Follows up #7218. We fixed to use `math.comb()` instead of `scipy.special.comb()` there to remove scipy dependency, however, it requires Python 3.8 or higher.

issue.title: Fix cusparseSpSM compatibility

labels.name: cat:bug
labels.description: Bugs

labels.name: to-be-backported
labels.description: Pull-requests to be backported to stable branch

labels.name: blocking
labels.description: Issue/pull-request is mandatory for the upcoming release

issue.body: CUDA 11.x basically have minor version compatibility. However, they have some APIs that are introduced in the middle of 11.x minor versions, which APIs do not exist in CUDA toolkit before they're introduced. In such a case we have to dlopen the APIs at runtime instead of (dynamic-)link them at build-time against the latest 11.x minor version. Otherwise, the process complains when the depending (cython-origin) shared object is loaded.

comment.body:
@kmaehashi Failed to backport automatically.

----

```
Not cleanly cherry-picked
```

issue.title: Use cuSPARSE Generic API instead of older one documented to be removed

labels.name: cat:enhancement
labels.description: Improvements to existing features

labels.name: to-be-backported
labels.description: Pull-requests to be backported to stable branch

issue.body:
Rel. #3513

Some cuSPARSE functions are announced to be removed in the next CUDA major release on its document. This PR fixes CuPy functions which use such older functions to use cuSPARSE Generic API instead.

**TODO**
- cupyx.scipy.sparse
  - cupyx/scipy/sparse/linalg/_solve.py
    - [x] fix spsolve_triangular to use spsm first (currently uses csrsm2)
    - [x] fix SuperLU.solve to use spsm first (curently uses csrsm2)
  - cupyx/scipy/sparse/_csc.py
    - [x] fix csc_matrix.\_\_mul__ to use spgemm
- cupy.cusparse
  - [x] update _available_cusparse_version
  - add spsm function
    - [x] CUDA
    - [x] HIP
- cupy_backends
  - add compat stubs
    - [x] add CUDA backend stubs for API to be removed in CUDA 12
  - add spsm bindings or stubs
    - [x] Cython
    - [x] cuda
    - [x] hip
    - [x] stub

**cuSPARSE API to be removed (32 cuSPARSE doc items)**

<details>

- cusparseAlgMode_t
- csrgemm2Info_t
- csrsm2Info_t
- csrsv2Info_t
- cusparseCreateCsrsv2Info
- cusparseDestroyCsrsv2Info
- cusparseCreateCsrsm2Info
- cusparseDestroyCsrsm2Info
- cusparseCreateCsrgemm2Info
- cusparseDestroyCsrgemm2Info
- cusparse\<t>axpyi
- cusparse\<t>gthr
- cusparse\<t>gthrz
- cusparse\<t>roti
- cusparse\<t>sctr
- cusparseCsrmvEx
- cusparse\<t>csrsv2_bufferSize
- cusparse\<t>csrsv2_analysis
- cusparse\<t>csrsv2_solve
- cusparseXcsrsv2_zeroPivot
- cusparse\<t>csrsm2_bufferSizeExt
- cusparse\<t>csrsm2_analysis
- cusparse\<t>csrsm2_solve
- cusparseXcsrsm2_zeroPivot
- cusparse\<t>gemmi
- cusparse\<t>csrgemm2
- cusparse\<t>csc2dense
- cusparse\<t>csr2dense
- cusparse\<t>dense2csc
- cusparse\<t>dense2csr
- cusparseSpMatSetStridedBatch
- cusparseConstrainedGeMM

</details>

comment.body: @asi1024 This pull-request is marked as `to-be-backported`, but the corresponding backport PR could not be found. Could you check?

issue.title: Fix wrong argument in warnings.warn()

labels.name: cat:bug
labels.description: Bugs

labels.name: to-be-backported
labels.description: Pull-requests to be backported to stable branch

issue.body:
The argument to `warnings.warn()`, added when `ndarray.scatter_max()` and `ndarray.scatter_min()` were deprecated, is not correct and `cupyx.scatter_max()` and `cupyx.scatter_min()` would result in the following error.
```
>>> import cupy as cp
>>> import cupyx
>>> a = cp.zeros(10)
>>> b = cp.arange(20)
>>> c = cp.arange(20)
>>> cupyx.scatter_max(a, b, c)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/cupyx/_scatter.py", line 91, in scatter_max
    a.scatter_max(slices, value)
  File "cupy/_core/core.pyx", line 1624, in cupy._core.core._ndarray_base.scatter_max
TypeError: 'type' object cannot be interpreted as an integer
```
This PR is to correct this problem.

comment.body:
@takagi Failed to backport automatically.

----

```
Not cleanly cherry-picked
```

issue.title: Fix wrong argument in warnings.warn()

labels.name: cat:bug
labels.description: Bugs

labels.name: to-be-backported
labels.description: Pull-requests to be backported to stable branch

issue.body:
The argument to `warnings.warn()`, added when `ndarray.scatter_max()` and `ndarray.scatter_min()` were deprecated, is not correct and `cupyx.scatter_max()` and `cupyx.scatter_min()` would result in the following error.
```
>>> import cupy as cp
>>> import cupyx
>>> a = cp.zeros(10)
>>> b = cp.arange(20)
>>> c = cp.arange(20)
>>> cupyx.scatter_max(a, b, c)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/cupyx/_scatter.py", line 91, in scatter_max
    a.scatter_max(slices, value)
  File "cupy/_core/core.pyx", line 1624, in cupy._core.core._ndarray_base.scatter_max
TypeError: 'type' object cannot be interpreted as an integer
```
This PR is to correct this problem.

comment.body:
@takagi Failed to backport automatically.

----

```
Not cleanly cherry-picked
```

issue.title: Fix cusparseSpSM compatibility

labels.name: cat:bug
labels.description: Bugs

labels.name: to-be-backported
labels.description: Pull-requests to be backported to stable branch

labels.name: blocking
labels.description: Issue/pull-request is mandatory for the upcoming release

issue.body: CUDA 11.x basically have minor version compatibility. However, they have some APIs that are introduced in the middle of 11.x minor versions, which APIs do not exist in CUDA toolkit before they're introduced. In such a case we have to dlopen the APIs at runtime instead of (dynamic-)link them at build-time against the latest 11.x minor version. Otherwise, the process complains when the depending (cython-origin) shared object is loaded.

issue.title: Use cuSPARSE Generic API instead of older one documented to be removed

labels.name: cat:enhancement
labels.description: Improvements to existing features

labels.name: to-be-backported
labels.description: Pull-requests to be backported to stable branch

issue.body:
Rel. #3513

Some cuSPARSE functions are announced to be removed in the next CUDA major release on its document. This PR fixes CuPy functions which use such older functions to use cuSPARSE Generic API instead.

**TODO**
- cupyx.scipy.sparse
  - cupyx/scipy/sparse/linalg/_solve.py
    - [x] fix spsolve_triangular to use spsm first (currently uses csrsm2)
    - [x] fix SuperLU.solve to use spsm first (curently uses csrsm2)
  - cupyx/scipy/sparse/_csc.py
    - [x] fix csc_matrix.\_\_mul__ to use spgemm
- cupy.cusparse
  - [x] update _available_cusparse_version
  - add spsm function
    - [x] CUDA
    - [x] HIP
- cupy_backends
  - add compat stubs
    - [x] add CUDA backend stubs for API to be removed in CUDA 12
  - add spsm bindings or stubs
    - [x] Cython
    - [x] cuda
    - [x] hip
    - [x] stub

**cuSPARSE API to be removed (32 cuSPARSE doc items)**

<details>

- cusparseAlgMode_t
- csrgemm2Info_t
- csrsm2Info_t
- csrsv2Info_t
- cusparseCreateCsrsv2Info
- cusparseDestroyCsrsv2Info
- cusparseCreateCsrsm2Info
- cusparseDestroyCsrsm2Info
- cusparseCreateCsrgemm2Info
- cusparseDestroyCsrgemm2Info
- cusparse\<t>axpyi
- cusparse\<t>gthr
- cusparse\<t>gthrz
- cusparse\<t>roti
- cusparse\<t>sctr
- cusparseCsrmvEx
- cusparse\<t>csrsv2_bufferSize
- cusparse\<t>csrsv2_analysis
- cusparse\<t>csrsv2_solve
- cusparseXcsrsv2_zeroPivot
- cusparse\<t>csrsm2_bufferSizeExt
- cusparse\<t>csrsm2_analysis
- cusparse\<t>csrsm2_solve
- cusparseXcsrsm2_zeroPivot
- cusparse\<t>gemmi
- cusparse\<t>csrgemm2
- cusparse\<t>csc2dense
- cusparse\<t>csr2dense
- cusparse\<t>dense2csc
- cusparse\<t>dense2csr
- cusparseSpMatSetStridedBatch
- cusparseConstrainedGeMM

</details>

comment.body: @asi1024 This pull-request is marked as `to-be-backported`, but the corresponding backport PR could not be found. Could you check?

issue.title: Fix wrong argument in warnings.warn()

labels.name: cat:bug
labels.description: Bugs

labels.name: to-be-backported
labels.description: Pull-requests to be backported to stable branch

issue.body:
The argument to `warnings.warn()`, added when `ndarray.scatter_max()` and `ndarray.scatter_min()` were deprecated, is not correct and `cupyx.scatter_max()` and `cupyx.scatter_min()` would result in the following error.
```
>>> import cupy as cp
>>> import cupyx
>>> a = cp.zeros(10)
>>> b = cp.arange(20)
>>> c = cp.arange(20)
>>> cupyx.scatter_max(a, b, c)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.8/dist-packages/cupyx/_scatter.py", line 91, in scatter_max
    a.scatter_max(slices, value)
  File "cupy/_core/core.pyx", line 1624, in cupy._core.core._ndarray_base.scatter_max
TypeError: 'type' object cannot be interpreted as an integer
```
This PR is to correct this problem.

comment.body:
@takagi Failed to backport automatically.

----

```
Not cleanly cherry-picked
```
